page.title: 03MOFFAT-PRESENT FROM PAST
page.content: Old Well Road,Well Street,Hydro Avenue and the Baths Hall.Add to these the Station Park.Place names which exist to provide clues to the town's prominence as a tourist centre.From its discovery early in the 17th. century to its decline in the early 20th.the Moffat Well established Moffat firmly on the tourist map.The opening of the Railway Station (closed 1954)consolidated its position.A resident population in the 1880's of 2150 could swell by 2000 during the summer months.The fine Victorian houses of Old Carlisle Road,Ballplay Road and Hartfell Cresent stand as reminders of this past.These buildings (many now guest houses or homes for the retired) acount for much of the 435 private housing identified in 1981.At that time 354 council properties existed(23 had been bought)
